Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a short round-tipped nozzle, a plain discus and a flat shoulder with mouldings. Within the multiple base-ring is the name PHOETASPI in relief, with a letter I above and S below. Buff clay, with large orange areas, some mica.
Curator's comments: Close (signed by Phoetaspus): Waldhauer, O., 1914. ‘Kaiserliche Ermitage, die antiken Tonlampen’. St. Petersburg, 409, from Panopolis; 'Bulletin de la Société Royale d'Archéologie d'Alexandrie' xxxv, 1942, pl. xxiv, fig. 2, from Abukir. Close (signature not mentioned): 'Listy Filologické' ci, 1979, fig. 4 (after p. 132), from Terenuthis, in the Delta; 'Bulletin de la Société Royale d'Archéologie d'Alexandrie' xxx-xxxi, 1937-8, p. 282, fig. 10, from Gabbary, Alexandria. Near (in red fabrics): L. Benaki Collection, Athens NAM, Inv. No. Mn 581, signed STROBILI in relief, and Inv. No. Mn 585, signed STROBI|S (incuse, s reversed).
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1960)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs W N Weech
